Bal Keshav Thackeray(IPA-mr'ʈʰa:kə'ɾei; 23 January 1926  17 November 2012) was an Indian politician who founded theShiv Sena, a right-wingMarathi peopleMarathiEthnocentrismethnocentricparty active mainly in the Western Indian state ofMaharashtra. He was called as 'Balasaheb' by his supporters. His followers called him theHindu Hruday Samraat("Emperor of Hindu Hearts").cite bookRam PuniyaniContours of Hindu Rashtra: Hindutva, Sangh Parivar, and Contemporary Politicshttps://books.google.com/books?id14 November 20121 January 2006Gyan Publishing House978-81-7835-473-6123

Thackeray began his professional career as acartoonistwith the English language dailyThe Free Press JournalinMumbai, but left it in 1960 to form his own political weeklyMarmik (periodical)Marmik.cite bookIndia Today: An Encyclopedia of Life in the Republic [2 volumes]: An Encyclopedia of Life in the Republic, Volume 1ABC-CLIOArnold P. Kaminsky, Roger D. Long Ph.D.2011https://books.google.com/books?idHis political philosophy was largely shaped by his fatherKeshav Sitaram Thackeray, a leading figure in theSamyukta Maharashtra Samiti''Samyukta Maharashtra''(United Maharashtra) movement, which advocated the creation of a separate linguistic state of Maharashtra. ThroughMarmik, he campaigned against the growing influence of non-Marathis in Mumbai.cite webRoar of the Tigerhttp://www.dnaindia.com/mumbai/slideshow_roar-of-the-tiger_1497754#top[[Daily News and Analysis|Daily News and Analysis (DNA)]]23 January 2011In 1966, Thackeray formed theShiv Senaparty to advocate for the interests ofMaharashtriansin Mumbai's political and professional landscape. In the late 1960s and early 1970s, Thackeray built the party by forming temporary alliances with nearly all of Maharashtra's political parties.cite bookKaminskyArnold P.LongRoger D.India Today: An Encyclopedia of Life in the Republic2011ABC-CLIO978-0-313-37462-3693–4illustratedThackeray was also the founder of the Marathi-language newspaperSaamanaand the Hindi-language newspaperDopahar ka saamana.cite webhttp://www.wan-press.org/3may/2000/profiles/IndiaGoenka.htmlIndiaWAN-IFRA30 September 2012He was the subject of numerous controversies.Upon his death, he was accorded astate funeralwith a large number of mourners present.
article.heading: Early and personal life
article.paragraph: Thackeray was born in the city ofPuneon 23 January 1926cite newsThe Firebrand Who Renamed Bombay: Bal Thackeray (1926–2012)http://world.time.com/2012/11/17/the-firebrand-who-renamed-bombay-bal-thackeray-1926-2012/Nov. 17, 2012 Time World14 June 201317 November 2012cite webShiv Sena wants Bal Thackeray memorial to take root ahead of his birthdayhttp://www.mid-day.com/news/2013/jan/180113-shiv-sena-wants-bal-thackeray-memorial-to-take-root-ahead-of-his-birthday.htmMidday . January 18, 201314 June 2013to Ramabai andKeshav Sitaram Thackeray(also known as 'Prabodhankar' Thackeray).cite bookArnold P.KaminskyRoger D.LongLizaWeinsteinIndia Today: An Encyclopedia of Life in the RepublicThackeray, Balsaheb Keshavhttps://books.google.com/books?id7 September 201230 September 2011ABC-CLIO978-0-313-37463-0693–694He was the eldest of nine siblings.cite webMilestones in the life of Sena chief Bal Thackerayhttp://www.hindustantimes.com/india-news/mumbai/milestones-in-the-life-of-sena-chief-bal-thackeray/article1-960556.aspxhttp://www.hindustantimes.comHT Media Limited.2 November 2014His family belonged to the MarathiChandraseniya Kayastha Prabhu(CKP) community.cite journalComparative Studies of South Asia, Africa and the Middle EastSouth Asia Bulletinhttps://books.google.com/books?id16211615 November 20121996University of California, Los AngelesKeshav Thackeray was a progressive social activist and writer who was involved in theSamyukta Maharashtra Movementof the 1950s that argued for the creation of a unified state called Maharashtra forMarathi languageMarathi-speaking areas withMumbaias its capital. His father was said to have supported the use of strategic violence as means to achieve that objective. Keshav Thakare left the movement because of his stance against the communists.citation neededYour explanation hereAugust 2015

Thackeray was married to Meena Thackeray (ne Vaidya) and had three sons, Bindumadhav Thackeray, Jaidev Thackeray andUddhav Thackeray.cite newsA political saga of a cartoonisthttp://www.andhrawishesh.com/home/hot-buzz/34781-a-political-saga-of-a-cartoonist.html17 November 2012Andhra Wishesh15 November 2012Meena and Bindumadhav died in 1996.cite newsIANSShiv Sena chief Bal Thackeray passes awayhttp://www.ianslive.in/index.php?param17 November 2012IANS17 November 2012
article.heading: Early career
article.paragraph: Thackeray began his career as a cartoonist in theFree Press Journalin Mumbai. His cartoons were also published in the Sunday edition ofThe Times of India. In 1960, he launched the cartoon weeklyMarmikwith his brother. He used it to campaign against the growing numbers and influence of non-Marathi people in Mumbai, targeting Gujaratis and South Indians.cite webhttp://www.dnaindia.com/mumbai/slideshow_roar-of-the-tiger_1497754#topRoar of the Tiger — DNADnaindia.com31 March 2012After Thackeray's differences with theFree Press Journal, he and four or five people, includingGeorge Fernandes, left the paper and started their own dailyNews Day. The paper survived for one or two months.Jerry Pinto, Naresh Fernandes. Bombay, Meri Jaan: Writings on Mumbai, p. 238
article.heading: Politics
article.paragraph: He formed theShiv Senaon 19 June 1966 with the intent of fighting for the rights of the natives of theStates of Indiastateof Maharashtra. The Party grew in power when in the early 1970s he was joined by senior leaders such as Marathi Literature HistorianBabasaheb Purandare,citation neededYour explanation hereAugust 2015Chief Attorney for Trade Union of Maharashtra Madhav Mehere as a party Attorney and experienced Trade Union Chartered Accountant Madhav Deshpande to back him up for various aspects of the party operations.cite webhttp://in.rediff.com/election/2004/apr/23espec3.htmKnow your party: Shiv Sena23 April 2004RediffThe early objective of the Shiv Sena was to ensure job security for Maharashtrians competing against immigrants from southern India, Gujaratis and Marwaris. In 1989, the Sena's newspaperSaamnawas launched.How Sena got the title 'Saamna' for mouthpiece, www.timesofindia.com, 19 November 2012. Retrieved 5 December 2012

Politically, the Shiv Sena wasAnti-communismanti-communist, and wrested control of trade unions in Mumbai from theCommunist Party of India. It later allied itself with theBharatiya Janata Party(BJP). The BJP-Shiv Sena alliance won the 1995Maharashtra Vidhan SabhaMaharashtra State Assemblyelections and came to power. During the tenure of the government from 1995 to 1999, Thackeray declared himself to the 'remote control' chief minister.cite bookMadhav GodboleUnfinished Innings: Recollections and Reflections of a Civil Servanthttps://books.google.com/books?id4 December 20121 January 1996Orient Blackswan978-81-250-0883-5414

On 28 July 1999 Thackeray was banned from voting and contesting in any election for six years from 11 December 1999 till 10 December 2005 on the recommendations of the Election Commission for indulging in corrupt practice by seeking votes in the name of religion.cite webhttp://www.hindustantimes.com/News-Feed/NM1/Thackeray-votes-after-expiry-of-ban/Article1-16731.aspxThackeray votes after expiry of banHindustan Times2004-04-262013-06-14cite webhttp://www.hinduonnet.com/thehindu/revents/01/19990199.htm#julBanned from voting[[The Hindu]]28 July 1999yeshttps://web.archive.org/20030425223423/http://www.hinduonnet.com:80/thehindu/revents/01/19990199.htm25 April 2003After the six-year voting ban on Thackeray was lifted in 2005, he voted for the first time in the 2007Brihanmumbai Municipal CorporationBMCelections.cite webhttp://www.mid-day.com/news/2009/oct/141009-Bal-Thackeray-Uddhav-Aditya-polling-booth-Election.htmThackeray ke Bal par...[[Mid Day]]14 October 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20091018072453/http://www.mid-day.com/news/2009/oct/141009-Bal-Thackeray-Uddhav-Aditya-polling-booth-Election.htm18 October 2009no

Thackeray claimed that the Shiv Sena had helped theMarathi manoos(Marathi peopleMarathi person)cite bookGyan PrakashMumbai Fableshttps://books.google.com/books?id4 December 201221 September 2010Princeton University Press978-0-691-15317-9228in Mumbai. Thackeray believed that Hindus must be organised to struggle against those who oppose their identity and religion.cite webhttp://www.hinduonnet.com/2003/11/24/stories/2003112400851000.htmOn the wrong track[[The Hindu]]11 August 2006especially in the public sector.cite newshttp://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2005-11-29/mumbai/27855110_1_shiv-sena-meow-maharashtriansSena fate: From roar to meowThe Times of India11 August 200629 November 2005Opposition leftist parties allege that the Shiv Sena has done little to solve the problem of unemployment facing a large proportion of Maharashtrian youth during its tenure, in contradiction to its ideological foundation of 'sons of the soil.'cite webhttp://www.hinduonnet.com/fline/fl2025/stories/20031219008601500.htmDiversionary tacticsThe Hindu Frontline Magazine8 August 2008yeshttps://web.archive.org/20080611194307/http://www.hinduonnet.com:80/fline/fl2025/stories/20031219008601500.htm11 June 2008
article.heading: Factionalism
article.paragraph: In 2006, Thackeray's nephewRaj Thackeraybroke away from Shiv Sena to form theMaharashtra Navnirman Sena(MNS). This was when Bal Thackeray on his retirement from active politics appointed his son,Uddhav ThackerayUddhavrather than Raj as the leader of Shiv Sena. Raj continues to maintain that Thackeray was his ideologue.cite newsMishraAmbarishराज महायात्रेत अलिप्त होते, कारण...http://maharashtratimes.indiatimes.com/articleshow/17276242.cmsMarathi20 November 2012Maharashtra Times19 November 2012
article.heading: Issues and actions
article.paragraph: On 14 February 2006, Thackeray condemned and apologised for the violent attacks by Shiv Sainiks upon a private Valentine's Day celebration in Mumbai. "It is said that women were beaten up in the Nallasopara incident. If that really happened, then it is a symbol of cowardice. I have always instructed Shiv Sainiks that in any situation women should not be humiliated and harassed."cite news[[Press Trust of India|PTI]] http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2006-02-18/india/27813894_1_sena-mouthpiece-saamna-sena-chief-bal-thackeray-shiv-sainiks Thackeray condemns V-Day attacks by Sainiks ''[[The Times of India]]'' 18 February 2006 13 November 2012 [[Mumbai]]Thackeray and the Shiv Sena remained opposed to Valentine's Day celebrations, although they indicated support for an "Indian alternative."cite newsPTI 13 Feb 2006, 08.55pm ISThttp://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2006-02-13/india/27806760_1_sena-chief-bal-thackeray-valentine-s-day-saamnaThackeray suggests Indian version of V-Day — Times Of IndiaThe Times of India13 February 200613 November 2012However, in some cases, the SS has been more tolerant during Valentine's Day celebrations.cite webhttp://www.ndtv.com/article/cities/right-wing-to-go-easy-on-couples-this-valentine-s-day-175815Right-wing to go easy on couples this Valentine's DayNDTV.com

Thackeray was criticised for his praise ofAdolf Hitler.P. 90 India and the International System By Gupta, Mannaraswamighala Sreeranga Rajan, Shivaji GangulyP. 201 Jawaharlal Nehru on Communalism By Nand Lal GuptaHe was quoted byAsiaweekas saying: "I am a great admirer of Hitler, and I am not ashamed to say so! I do not say that I agree with all the methods he employed, but he was a wonderful organiser and orator, and I feel that he and I have several things in common...What India really needs is adictatorwho will rule benevolently, but with an iron hand."cite webiPad iPhone Android TIME TV Populist The Pagehttp://www.asiaweek.com/asiaweek/95/0922/nat5.htmlTIME Magazine — Asia Edition — November 19, 2012 No. 21Asiaweek.com13 November 2012However,Indian Expresspublished an interview 29 January 2007: "Hitler did very cruel and ugly things. But he was an artist, I love him [for that]. He had the power to carry the whole nation, the mob with him. You have to think what magic he had. He was a miracle...The killing of Jews was wrong. But the good part about Hitler was that he was an artist. He was a daredevil. He had good qualities and bad. I may also have good qualities and bad ones."cite webhttp://www.indianexpress.com/story/21977-3.htmlSorryIndianexpress.com13 November 2012
He later told theStar Talktalk showonStar Plusthat he did not admire Hitler.[Balasaheb Thakre http://maharashtrainformation.com/page.php?id=232]
article.heading: Accusations of Xenophobia
article.paragraph: Thackeray and the Shiv Sena were blamed for inciting violence against Muslims during the 19921993Mumbai riotsin an inquiry ordered by thegovernment of India- the Srikrishna Commission Report.cite webhttp://www.frontlineonnet.com/fl1517/15170200.htmNavigation News | FrontlineFrontlineonnet.com2013-06-14Following the riots, Thackeray took stances viewed as anti-Muslim. In 2002, Thackeray issued a call to form Hindusuicide bombersquads to take on the menace of terrorism.cite newshttp://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2002-10-15/india/27292201_1_suicide-squads-annual-dussehra-rally-state-and-central-govenmentsThackeray for Hindu suicide squads2013-06-27[[Times of India]]15 October 2002In response, the Maharashtra government registered a case against him for inciting enmity between different groups.cite newshttp://www.expressindia.com/fullstory.php?newsidCase filed against Thackeray for urging anti-terror suicide-squads25 August 2007ExpressIndia.comhttps://web.archive.org/web/20070930181915/http://www.expressindia.com/fullstory.php?newsid30 September 2007noAt least two organisations founded and managed by retired Indian Army officers, Lt Col Jayant Rao Chitale and Lt Gen. P.N. Hoon (former commander-in-chief of the Western Command), responded to the call with such statements as not allowing Pakistanis to work in India due to accusations against Pakistan for supporting attacks in India by militants.cite newshttp://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-02-12/india/28114312_1_multiplex-owners-inclusion-of-pakistani-players-single-screen-theatresTOI28 February 2010Despite Sena threat, 'MNIK' opens to packed theatres across country12 February 2010cite newshttp://ibnlive.in.com/blogs/rajdeepsardesai/1/61523/an-open-letter-to-uddhav-thackeray.htmlAn open letter to Uddhav Thackeray12 February 2010IBN17 November 2012

Thackeray also declared that he was "not against every Muslim, but only those who reside in this country but do not obey the laws of the land...I consider such people [to be] traitors."cite webSherman Hollarhttp://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/1090091/Bal-ThackerayBal Thackeray (Indian journalist and politician)Britannica Online Encyclopedia23 January 192715 November 2012The Shiv Sena is viewed by the liberal media as being anti-Muslim, though Shiv Sainiks officially reject this accusation.cite webhttp://in.rediff.com/election/2004/apr/23espec3.htmKnow your party: Shiv Sena — Lok Sabha Election 2009In.rediff.com23 April 200431 March 2012When explaining his views onHindutva, he conflated Islam with violence and called on Hindus to "fight terrorism and fight Islam."cite webhttp://www.ibnlive.com/news/thackeray-rants-after-tiger-win/top/32673-4.html?xmlThackeray lashes out at Prez againIbnlive.com3 February 200715 November 2012In an interview with Suketu Mehta, he called for the mass expulsion of illegal Bangladeshi Muslim migrants from India and for avisa (document)visasystem to enter Mumbai, theIndian National Congressstate government had earlier during theIndira Gandhideclared national emergency considered a similar measure.cite bookMihir BoseThe Magic of Indian Cricket: Cricket And Society in Indiahttps://books.google.com/books?id4 December 20122006Taylor & Francis Group978-0-415-35691-688cite bookSuketu MehtaMaximum Cityhttps://books.google.com/books?id17 November 201227 September 2005Random House Digital, Inc.978-0-375-70340-9101

He toldIndia Today"[Muslims] areEliminationismspreading like a cancer and should be operated on like a cancer. The...country should be saved from the Muslims and the police should support them [Hindu Maha Sangh] in their struggle just like the police in Punjab were sympathetic to the Khalistanis."Bal Thackeray inIndia Today, Shiv Sena leader of Bombay, June 15, 1984.However, in an interview in 1998, he said that his stance had changed on many issues that the Shiv Sena had with Muslims, particularly regarding the Babri Mosque orRam Janmabhoomiissue:cite webhttp://www.rediff.com/news/1998/jan/21nandy.htmThe Rediff Interview/ Bal ThackerayRediff.com21 January 199815 November 2012"We must look after the Muslims and treat them as part of us."He also expressed admiration for Muslims in Mumbai in the wake of the11 July 2006 Mumbai train bombingsperpetrated byIslamic fundamentalismIslamic fundamentalists. In response to threats made byAbu Azmi, a leader of theSamajwadi Party, that accusations of terrorism directed at Indian Muslims would bring about communal strife, Thackeray said that the unity of Mumbaikars (residents of Mumbai) in the wake of the attacks was "a slap to fanatics of Samajwadi Party leader Abu Asim Azmi" and that Thackeray "salute[s] those Muslims who participated in the two minutes' silence on July 18 to mourn the blast victims."cite newshttp://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2006-07-20/india/27814176_1_blast-victims-serial-blasts-sena-chief-bal-thackerayThe Times Of IndiaMumbai's unity a slap to fanatics: Thackeray20 July 2006Again in 2008 he wrote: "Islamic terrorism is growing and Hindu terrorism is the only way to counter it. We need suicide bomb squads to protect India and Hindus."Leaders deliver hate speech with impunity. IBNLive, 7 April 2009.He also reiterated a desire for Hindus to unite across linguistic barriers to see "a Hindustan for Hindus" and to "bring Islam in this country down to its knees."cite newshttp://www.expressindia.com/news/fullstory.php?newsidHindustan of Hindus my dream: Thackeray29 January 200720 November 2012Indian Expres

In 2008, following agitation against Biharis and other north Indians travelling to Maharashtra to take civil service examinations for theIndian Railwaysdue to an overlimit of the quota in their home provinces, Thackeray also said of Bihari MPs that they were "spitting in the same plate from which they ate" when they criticised Mumbaikars and Maharashtrians. He wrote: "They are trying to add fuel to the fire that has been extinguished, by saying that Mumbaikars have rotten brains." He also criticisedChhath Puja, a holiday celebrated by Biharis and those from eastern Uttar Pradesh, which occurs on six day of the Hindu month of Kartik. He said that it was not a real holiday.This was reportedly a response to MPs from Bihar who had disrupted the proceedings of theLok Sabhain protest to the attacks on North Indians.cite newshttp://www.indianexpress.com/story/281062.htmlRattled by Raj, Thackeray abuses Biharis news''[[The Indian Express]]''2 February 2008Bihar Chief MinisterNitish Kumar, upset with the remarks, called on the prime minister and the central government to intervene in the matter. ASaamnaeditorial prompted at least 16 MPs from Bihar and Uttar Pradesh, belonging to theRashtriya Janata Dal,Janata Dal (United), Samajwadi Party and theIndian National Congress, to give notice forbreach of privilegeproceedings against Thackeray.After the matter was raised in the Lok Sabha,Speaker of Lok SabhaSpeakerSomnath Chatterjeesaid: "If anybody has made any comment on our members' functioning in the conduct of business in the House, not only do we treat that with the contempt that it deserves, but also any action that may be necessary will be taken according to procedure and well established norms. Nobody will be spared."

On 27 March 2008, in protest to Thackeray's editorial, leaders of Shiv Sena inDelhiresigned, citing its "outrageous conduct" towards non-Marathis in Maharashtra and announced that they would form a separate party.Addressing a press conference, Shiv Sena's North India chief Jai Bhagwan Goyal said the decision to leave the party was taken because of the "partial attitude" of the party high command towards Maharashtrians. Goyal further said "Shiv Sena is no different fromKhalistanand Jammu and Kashmir militant groups which are trying to create a rift between people along regional lines. The main aim of these forces is to split our country. Like theMaharashtra Navnirman Sena, the Shiv Sena too has demeaned North Indians and treated them inhumanely."cite newshttp://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2008-03-27/india/27771941_1_shiv-sena-jai-bhagwan-goyal-marathis''[[The Times of India]]''4 April 2008Shiv Sena’s North Indian leaders quit27 March 2008cite newshttp://www.hindu.com/2008/03/28/stories/2008032851310300.htm4 April 2008''[[The Hindu]]''Delhi Shiv Sena chief resignsChennai, India28 March 2008https://web.archive.org/web/20080402101931/http://www.hindu.com/2008/03/28/stories/2008032851310300.htm2 April 2008no

The 2011 documentaryJai Bhim Comradedepicted a speech by Thackeray at a public rally, in which he articulated "genocidal sentiments" about Muslims, stating that they were the "species to be exterminated." The documentary followed this by showing severalDalitleaders criticizing Thackeray for his beliefs.cite journalMatznerDeborah''Jai Bhim Comrade'' and the Politics of Sound in Urban Indian Visual CultureVisual Anthropology ReviewFall 2014304127–1381 December 2014Following Thackeray's death in 2012, the Pakistani newspaperExpress Tribunepublished an editorial defining him as a "bigot" who instigated racism and violence against Muslims.cite newshttp://tribune.com.pk/story/468078/bal-thackeray/Bal ThackerayThe Express Tribune19 November 201230 May 2015
article.heading: Death
article.paragraph: File:Bal Thackeray and Madhuri Dixit at 70th Master Dinanath Mangeshkar Awards (4).jpgthumbrightThackeray with actressMadhuri Dixitin 2012 shortly before his death.Thackeray died on 17 November 2012 as a consequence of acardiac arrest.cite newsMumbai Bureauhttp://www.thehindu.com/news/states/other-states/bal-thackeray-passes-away/article4105003.eceStates / Other States : Bal Thackeray passes away; funeral on SundayThe Hindu15 November 201219 November 2012Chennai, IndiaMumbai came to a virtual halt immediately as the news broke out about his death, with shops and commercial establishments downing their shutters.cite newsMumbai shuts down as Bal Thackeray makes final journey todayhttp://www.hindustantimes.com/India-news/Mumbai/Mumbai-shuts-down-as-Bal-Thackeray-makes-final-journey-today/Article1-960828.aspx18 November 2012[[Hindustan Times]]18 November 2012MankikarSayli UdasGhogeKetakiMumbai, IndiaThe entire state of Maharashtra was put on high alert. The police appealed for calm and 20,000Mumbai policeofficers, 15 units of the State Reserve Police Force and three contingents of theRapid Action Forcewere deployed.cite newshttp://www.dnaindia.com/mumbai/report_security-beefed-up-across-maharashtra_1765851Security beefed up across MaharashtraPTIDNA India17 November 2012

Prime MinisterManmohan Singhcalled for calm in the city and praised Thackeray's "strong leadership", while there were also statements of praise and condolences from other senior politicians such as the chief minister of Gujarat (Now Prime Minister of India),Narendra Modi, and the BJP leader and MP,L. K. Advani.cite newshttp://www.hindustantimes.com/India-news/Mumbai/Traders-bandh-in-Maharashtra-tomorrow-to-pay-homage-to-Bal-Thackeray/Article1-960974.aspxTraders bandh in Maharashtra tomorrow to pay homage to Bal ThackerayHindustan Times18 November 2012PTI19 November 2012

He was accorded astate funeralcite newshttp://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-11-20/mumbai/35227624_1_public-holiday-state-funerals-ministerState funeral: CM went by people's sentimentsBhartiJain20 November 2012The Times of India3 August 2013atShivaji Park, which generated some controversycite newshttp://www.dnaindia.com/mumbai/report_thackeray-funeral-at-public-ground-shivaji-park-sparks-debate_1766308Thackeray funeral at 'public ground' Shivaji Park sparks debate19 November 20127 December 2012DNA Indiaand resulted from demands made by Shiv Sena.cite newshttp://www.hindustantimes.com/India-news/Mumbai/Demand-for-Thackeray-memorial-at-Shivaji-Park/Article1-961196.aspxDemand for Thackeray memorial at Shivaji ParkHindustan TimesSayli UdasMankikar19 November 20127 December 2012It was the first public funeral in the city since that ofBal Gangadhar Tilakin 1920.cite webState funeral for Bal Thackeray, calm city lines uphttp://www.financialexpress.com/news/state-funeral-for-bal-thackeray-calm-city-lines-up/1032864financialexpress29 May 2013Thackeray's body was moved to the park on 18 November.cite newshttp://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/politics/nation/bal-thackeray-passes-away-mumbai-remains-shut/articleshow/17265776.cmsBal Thackeray passes away: Mumbai remains shutEconomic Times18 November 201219 November 2012Many mourners attended his funeral, although there were no official figures. The range reported in media sources varied from around 1 million,cite web19 November 2012http://www.deccanchronicle.com/121119/news-current-affairs/article/maha-end-tiger-journeyMaha end to Tiger journeyDeccan Chronicle19 November 2012to 1.5 millioncite news19 November 2012Mumbai returns to normal after Bal Thackeray funeralBBC30 November 2012and as many as nearly 2 million.cite newshttp://indiatoday.intoday.in/video/nearly-20-lakh-people-join-the-funeral-procession-of-shiv-sena-supremo-bal-thackeray-as-mumbai-comes-to-a-standstill/1/229716.html?utm_mediumNearly 20 lakh people join the funeral procession of Shiv Sena supremo Bal Thackeray as Mumbai comes to a standstillIndia Today18 November 201219 November 2012His cremation took place the next day, where his son Uddhav lit the pyre.cite newshttp://zeenews.india.com/news/nation/bal-thackerays-funeral-cortege-leaves-for-shivaji-park_811455.htmlShiv Sena chief Bal Thackeray cremated, Uddhav lights funeral pyreZee News19 November 20127 December 2012Among those present at his cremation were senior representatives of theGovernment of MaharashtraMaharashtra governmentand the event was broadcast live on national television channels.cite newshttp://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-11-18/india/35185749_1_funeral-procession-uddhav-bal-thackerayBal Thackeray's funeral procession gets massive live TV coverageThe Times of IndiaIANS19 November 20127 December 2012The Parliament of India opened for its winter session on 21 November 2012. Thackeray was the only non-member to be noted in its traditional list of obituaries. He is one of few people to have been recorded thus without being a member of either the Lok Sabha or the Rajya Sabha.cite newsDNA Indiahttp://www.dnaindia.com/mumbai/report_bal-thackeray-only-non-mp-to-get-obituary-reference-in-parliament_1768110Bal Thackeray only non-MP to get obituary reference in Parliament22 November 2012IANS7 December 2012Despite having not held any official position, he was given the21-gun salute, which was again a rare honour.cite webShiv Sena pays Rs 5 lakh for Bal Thackeray's funeral expenseshttp://zeenews.india.com/news/maharashtra/shiv-sena-pays-rs-5-lakh-for-bal-thackeray-s-funeral-expenses_850513.htmlMay 24, 2013. Zee Media Bureau29 May 2013Both houses ofBiharAssembly also paid tribute.cite webhttp://zeenews.india.com/news/bihar/bihar-assembly-pays-tribute-to-bal-thackeray_813570.htmlBihar Assembly pays tribute to Bal ThackerayZeenews.india.com2012-11-292013-06-14cite webPTIhttp://news.in.msn.com/national/bihar-assembly-pays-tribute-to-sena-chief-bal-thackerayBihar assembly pays tribute to Sena chief Bal ThackerayNews.in.msn.com2012-11-292013-06-14cite webhttp://ibnlive.in.com/news/bihar-assembly-pays-tribute-to-shiv-sena-chief-bal-thackeray/308027-3.htmlBihar Assembly pays tribute to Shiv Sena chief Bal ThackerayIbnlive.in.com2013-06-14
